gr.forth.ics.graph
Interface Graph

All Superinterfaces:
InspectableGraph
All Known Implementing Classes:
FoldingGraph, GraphForwarder, PrimaryGraph, SecondaryGraph
public interface Graph
extends InspectableGraph

A modifiable graph.

Graphs can be either primary or not (i.e., secondary). Node and edges can be contained to at most one primary graph, but as many secondary graphs as needed. Primary graphs are more efficient than secondaries, but secondaries are more flexible. Specifically, every node or edge can only be contained at most in one primary graph, but they are allowed to be contained in arbitrarily many secondary graphs. Note that before a node is removed, its incident edges are removed (as the invariant of the edges contained in this graph is that both nodes at their endings are always contained in the same graph).

See Also:
InspectableGraph, Node, Edge, gr.forth.ics.graph.concrete.PrimaryGraph, gr.forth.ics.graph.concrete.SecondaryGraph

             Node node2)
Creates and returns a new edge that start at node1 and ends at node2. Equivalent to newEdge(node1, node2, null).

Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - when !containsNode(node1) or !containsNode(node2)

             Node node2,
             Object value)

Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - when !containsNode(node1) or !containsNode(node2)

removeEdge

boolean removeEdge(Edge edge)
Removes the specified edge, if it is currently contained to this graph. If the edge is null, nothing happens.

Returns:
whether the specified edge was indeed contained in this graph, and has been removed

removeEdges

int removeEdges(Iterable<Edge> edges)
Removes the specified edges. If the parameter is null, nothing happens, and zero is returned.

Returns:
the number of edges that were contained in this graph and removed

removeAllEdges

int removeAllEdges()
Removes every edge of this graph.

Returns:
the number of edges removed

newNodes

Node[] newNodes(int count)
Creates the specified number of nodes, and return them as an array.

Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if count is less than zero

newNodes

Node[] newNodes(Object... values)
Creates as many nodes as the number of arguments supplied and returns them as an array. Each node's value is set to the respective argument.

removeNode

boolean removeNode(Node node)
Removes the specified node. If the node is null, nothing happens.
Note: When a node is removed, all its incident edges are also removed.

Returns:
whether the specified node was contained in this graph and was removed

removeNodes

int removeNodes(Iterable<Node> nodes)
Removes the specified nodes. If the parameter is null, nothing happens, and zero is returned.
Note: When a node is removed, all its incident edges are also removed.

Returns:
the number of nodes that were contained in this graph and removed

removeAllNodes

int removeAllNodes()
Effectively clears the graph; removes all nodes and, thus, edges.

Returns:
the number of nodes that were removed

getOrderManager

Graph.OrderManager getOrderManager()
Returns the OrderManager of this graph (optional method).

See Also:
Graph.OrderManager

importGraph

void importGraph(Graph graph)
Imports all the contents of the specified graph, into this graph. After the successful execution of this method, the specified graph is empty, and all nodes and edges it contained have been inserted to this graph.

Throws:
gr.forth.ics.util.NullArgumentException - if argument is null
See Also:
importGraph(Graph, Iterable)

importGraph

Collection<Edge> importGraph(Graph graph,
                             Iterable<Node> nodes)
Imports a subpart of the specified graph, into this graph. The subpart is consisted of the nodes specified, and every edge that both its nodes are contained in the group. Every other edge, that connects a node to be imported and a node that will not be removed, is removed and returned as a Collection.

Returns:
a collection of edges that have one node that belongs to the declared nodes, and one node that does not belong to them (i.e., inter-edge)
Throws:
gr.forth.ics.util.NullArgumentException - if any argument is null

isPrimary

boolean isPrimary()
Returns whether this graph is primary or not.

See Also:
Graph, gr.forth.ics.graph.concrete.PrimaryGraph, gr.forth.ics.graph.concrete.SecondaryGraph

reinsertNode

boolean reinsertNode(Node n)
Reinserts a node in this graph. Note: A node can belong at any time at most to one primary graph. Whether a graph is primary may be obtained through the isPrimary() method. So, it this graph is primary, the node must not belong to any primary graph.

Returns:
true if the node is actually reinserted in the graph (i.e., it was not already there)
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - when node is already contained in a primary graph

reinsertEdge

boolean reinsertEdge(Edge e)
Reinserts an edge in this graph. Each node of the edge that do not belong to this graph is reinserted to this graph prior to reinserting the edge itself. Note: An edge can belong at any time at most to one primary graph. Whether a graph is primary may be obtained through the isPrimary() method. So, it this graph is primary, the edge must not belong to any primary graph.

Returns:
true if the edge is actually reinserted in the graph (i.e., it was not already there)
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - when the edge or either of its nodes is already contained in a primary graph
